meanings.definition: Join or bond (metal) by the application of heat and a filler metal.
meanings.sent1: I soldered the wires together to make a strong connection.
meanings.sent2: The plumber soldered the pipes to fix the leak.
meanings.sent3: The robot mistakenly soldered its own circuits, causing a short circuit.
meanings.sent4: Her words soldered our hearts together in friendship.
meanings.sent5: The sun soldered the sand into a shimmering glass-like surface.

meanings.sent1: Dad soldered the broken toy back together for me.
meanings.sent2: The jeweler soldered the necklace clasp to make it secure.
meanings.sent3: The chef tried to solder the burnt cake, but it was beyond repair.
meanings.sent4: His kindness soldered the community after the disaster.
meanings.sent5: The artist's brush soldered the colors into a beautiful masterpiece.
